column_.text_:
Our adventure began with a strange light falling over my home island of Zinkenstill. I chased it to
the impact site, where I found a blue-haired girl named Lyria and a knight, Katalina.

Our adventure began with a strange light falling over my home island of Zinkenstill. I chased it to
the impact site, where I found a blue-haired girl named Lyria and a knight, Katalina.

The girl was shaken, and pretty soon, I learned the reason why. She was on the run from Erste
Empire soldiers.

The girl was shaken, and pretty soon, I learned the reason why. She was on the run from Erste
Empire soldiers.
I knew an unfair fight when I saw one, so I stepped up to protect Lyria from those awful tyrants.

I knew an unfair fight when I saw one, so I stepped up to protect Lyria from those overbearing
jerks.

Katalina and I fended them off well enough. But when their backs were in the corner, they
released a fire-breathing hydra. It charged me, sending me flying into the tree line.

Katalina and I fended them off well enough. But when their backs were in the corner, they
released a fire-breathing hydra. It charged me, sending me flying into the tree line.

Moments away from death, all I could think about was Dad. He'd been the one who trained me,
and he'd done a great job, but... Well, who expects their son to get attacked by a five-headed
horror? He was going to be devastated.

Moments away from death, all I could think about was Dad. He'd been the one who trained me,
and he'd done a great job, but... Well, who expects their daughter to get attacked by a five-headed
horror? He was going to be devastated.
"So, it's all over..."
"So, it's all over..."

Just as I began to sink into darkness, a gentle light enveloped my body. Lyria, wreathed by a
mystical halo, was floating above me with her hand outstretched. She explained that she was
going to merge our life forces...

Just as I began to sink into darkness, a gentle light enveloped my body. Lyria, wreathed by a
mystical halo, was floating above me with her hand outstretched. She explained that she was
going to merge our life forces...
Fortunately, it worked. From that moment forward, Lyria and I would be inextricably linked.
Fortunately, it worked. From that moment forward, Lyria and I would be inextricably linked.
Looking into her blue eyes, I knew I had nothing to fear, not even death itself.
Looking into her blue eyes, I knew I had nothing to fear, not even death itself.
Two people, one life. A greater whole.
Two people, one life. A greater whole.

Lyria had taken a huge risk to save me. Now, if one of us got hit with a fatal blow, it was curtains
for both. And that thought awakened in me a desperate hunger for survival... For life.

Lyria had taken a huge risk to save me. Now, if one of us got hit with a fatal blow, it was curtains
for both. And that thought awakened in me a desperate hunger for survival... For life.

The next moment, Lyria and I felt this reverberation of power. The torrent of emotion rushing from
me had awakened something.

The next moment, Lyria and I felt this reverberation of power. The torrent of emotion rushing from
me had awakened something.

Darkness and flames swirled around us, coalescing into a massive dragon... Bahamut. With him
on our side, we made short work of the imperial hydra.

Darkness and flames swirled around us, coalescing into a massive dragon... Bahamut. With him
on our side, we made short work of the imperial hydra.

Now that their trump card had been blasted into oblivion, the imperial army had no choice but to
run.

Now that their trump card had been blasted into oblivion, the imperial army had no choice but to
run.

Sometimes I wonder what would've happened if I hadn't chased that light. No Lyria, no life link, no
adventure. Man, I probably wouldn't even have set foot off of Zinkenstill.

Sometimes I wonder what would've happened if I hadn't chased that light. No Lyria, no life link, no
adventure. Yeesh, I probably wouldn't even have set foot off of Zinkenstill.
Fate's a funny thing, isn't it?
Fate's a funny thing, isn't it?
Since meeting Lyria, we've seen our fair share of joy and happiness, and pain and suffering.
Since meeting Lyria, we've seen our fair share of joy and happiness, and pain and suffering.

But the Grandcypher crew doesn't buckle under pressure. We'll take on anything the journey
throws at us. No regrets.

But the Grandcypher crew doesn't buckle under pressure. We'll take on anything the journey
throws at us. No regrets.

Now, where was I? Oh right. We'd just humiliated the empire... who probably had reserves waiting
somewhere close by. We realized we needed to get off Zinkenstill. Fast.

Now, where was I? Oh right. We'd just humiliated the empire... who probably had reserves waiting
somewhere close by. We realized we needed to get off Zinkenstill. Fast.

The empire was not going to rest while Lyria was on the loose, and I figured that since we shared
a life force now and all, it was in everyone's best interests if we stayed together. Plus, I'd always
wanted to explore the far reaches of the skies—though doing it on the run? Not what I had in
mind.

The empire was not going to rest while Lyria was on the loose, and I figured that since we shared
a life force now and all, it was in everyone's best interests if we stayed together. Plus, I'd always
wanted to explore the far reaches of the skies—though doing it on the run? Not what I had in
mind.
There was so much to think about. So much to decide.
There was so much to think about. So much to decide.

But all those plans could come after we had escaped Zinkenstill. I didn't want a whole army, this
time with—I don't know—thirty hydras marching on my home island.

But all those plans could come after we had escaped Zinkenstill. I didn't want a whole army, this
time with—I don't know—thirty hydras marching on my home island.
And, well, I had another, more personal reason for wanting to leave...
And, well, I had another, more personal reason for wanting to leave...

"Before I knew it, our journey was at an end. The end. As in, we'd reached the end of the skies. My
son, I'm waiting for you on Estalucia."

"Before I knew it, our journey was at an end. The end. As in, we'd reached the end of the skies. My
daughter, I'm waiting for you on Estalucia."
I thought about Dad's letter. I missed him.
I thought about Dad's letter. I missed him.

When I was young, he would take me to the edge of the island, and we'd sit there, admiring the
clouds. I wanted so badly to explore those skies, just like Dad. I had to see him again.

When I was young, he would take me to the edge of the island, and we'd sit there, admiring the
clouds. I wanted so badly to explore those skies, just like Dad. I had to see him again.

And now, I wouldn't have to make that journey alone. With Vyrn, Lyria, and Katalina at my side, we
commandeered a small imperial craft and set out for the greatest of destinations: Estalucia.

And now, I wouldn't have to make that journey alone. With Vyrn, Lyria, and Katalina at my side, we
commandeered a small imperial craft and set out for the greatest of destinations: Estalucia.
From the moment we left Zinkenstill, our adventures were hectic, to say the least.
From the moment we left Zinkenstill, our adventures were hectic, to say the least.

Katalina, who claimed to be an experienced pilot, crashed our small vessel into the gusty fields of
Port Breeze. But we quickly pulled ourselves together and found a new ally—and helmsman—in
the form of Rackam.

Katalina, who claimed to be an experienced pilot, crashed our small vessel into the gusty fields of
Port Breeze. But we quickly pulled ourselves together and found a new ally—and helmsman—in
the form of Rackam.

Since then, we gained more and more allies; and no matter what obstacle we faced, the crew
always worked in tandem to find a solution.

Since then, we gained more and more allies; and no matter what obstacle we faced, the crew
always worked in tandem to find a solution.
It's all thanks to their support that I've made it this far.
It's all thanks to their support that I've made it this far.

And what a wild ride it's been. To think, I had never even set foot off of Zinkenstill, but now I can't
even count the number of islands we've saved—let alone visited.

And what a wild ride it's been. I had never set foot off of Zinkenstill, but now I can't even count the
number of islands we've saved—let alone visited.
Sure, being a roving band of heroes is difficult, but it's got its perks.
Sure, being a roving band of heroes is difficult, but it's got its perks.
New faces, new places, and a whole airship's worth of fun—who could pass this life up?
New faces, new places, and a whole airship's worth of fun—who could pass this life up?
Anyway. We've just begun the next chapter of our adventure.
Anyhoodle. We've just begun the next chapter of our adventure.

We discovered another piece of the Sky Map, which led us to Zegagrande. Yeah, a whole new
Skydom. Just imagine the danger, the promise.

We discovered another piece of the Sky Map, which led us to Zegagrande. Yeah, a whole new
Skydom. Just imagine the danger, the promise.

But I knew it was going to be fine. Just another set of memories to add to our ever-growing
collection.

But I knew it was going to be fine. Just another set of memories to add to our ever-growing
collection.
I hope you're ready, Zegagrande. 'Cause here we come.
I hope you're ready, Zegagrande. 'Cause here we come.
"Skyfarers, we need your aid! Goblins! Goblins in Tempeal!"

We were at the dock in Folca, taking care of landing procedures, when a panicked old merchant
rushed toward us. In between his wheezing, he explained that a shipment of relief supplies headed
for Tempeal had been intercepted by monsters.

We were at the dock in Folca, taking care of landing procedures, when a panicked old merchant
rushed toward us. In between his wheezing, he explained that a shipment of relief supplies headed
for Tempeal had been intercepted by monsters.

Tempeal reminded me of Id, and how he had totally beat our butts. It was embarrassing, yeah, but
what's worse, it reminded me of losing Lyria.

Tempeal reminded me of Id, and how he had totally beat our butts. It was embarrassing, yeah, but
what's worse, it reminded me of losing Lyria.
"Tempeal, huh? Maybe this time around, I can actually help out..."
That wasn't Vyrn's usual peppy tone... He was probably reliving those bad memories, just like me.
That wasn't Vyrn's usual peppy tone... He was probably reliving those bad memories, just like me.
I guess after you've spent as much time together as we have, you pretty much share a brain.
I guess after you've spent as much time together as we have, you pretty much share a brain.

It wasn't going to be a fun journey to Tempeal for either of us, but we were skyfarers and
desperate times called for brave faces.

It wasn't going to be a fun journey to Tempeal for either of us, but we were skyfarers and
desperate times called for brave faces.

Anyway, goblins. Smart, fast. That meant we wouldn't have the luxury of time. We needed to
throw together the minimum amount of supplies needed for the journey and head out. I turned to
Vyrn so we could discuss game plans, but then I saw his ears were droopy.

Anyways, goblins. Smart, fast. That meant we wouldn't have the luxury of time. We needed to
throw together the minimum amount of supplies needed for the journey and head out. I turned to
Vyrn so we could discuss game plans, but then I saw his ears were droopy.
"If we're fighting goblins... then we should have 'em licked by lunch!"

Something was wrong, but with the hasty flight preparations, I couldn't spare the few minutes to
investigate. Pull through it, Vyrn, I thought. We need you.

Something was wrong, but with the hasty flight preparations, I couldn't spare the few minutes to
investigate. Pull through it, Vyrn, I thought. We need you.
A little less than an hour later, it was time to depart, but Vyrn was nowhere to be found.
A little less than an hour later, it was time to depart, but Vyrn was nowhere to be found.
"Hurry, skyfarers! We can't waste another second!"

The later we got there, the more supplies would be stolen or destroyed. This could add up to
weeks or even months of delay in Tempeal's restoration.

The later we got there, the more supplies would be stolen or destroyed. This could add up to
weeks or even months of delays in Tempeal's restoration.
"Vyrn... I hope you're okay, bud..."
"Vyrn... I hope you're okay, bud..."

I was worried out of my mind, but a captain's gotta do what a captain's gotta do. I left a message
for Vyrn with the merchant, and we set out.

I was worried out of my mind, but a captain's gotta do what a captain's gotta do. I left a message
for Vyrn with the merchant, and we set out.
Goblins... I can't even fight stinkin' goblins...
What good am I? Just a scaredy-lizard who brings everybody down.
Maaan...
If only I was more like my pal, swinging swords and shootin' spells.
If only I was more like my pal, swinging swords and shootin' spells.

Then I'd finally be able to help out. Maybe I coulda stopped Avia from taking Lyria. Maybe I coulda
done something.

How do you live the skyfaring life without combat skills? Heck, I can't even blow sparks, much
less fire. What kinda dragon can't breathe fire?
Hah. I tell everybody I'm a cool dragon... But I'm just a faker.
"You are unworthy."
"You are unworthy."

You were right, Id. I'm not worthy. Not worthy of being in the crew; not worthy of being
's best bud.

You were right, Id. I'm not worthy. Not worthy of being in the crew; not worthy of being
's best bud.
"Ah, finally! Here you are! I was looking everywhere for you!"
Huh? What did this old dude want with me?

" left you a message. The crew's gone on ahead, but as an indispensable member
of the Grandcypher, they want you with 'em as soon as possible. And that's an order."

" left you a message. The crew's gone on ahead, but as an indispensable member
of the Grandcypher, they want you with 'em as soon as possible. And that's an order."
Uh... indispensable? That meant, like, VIP, right? Me?

For a second there, I was about to blow it off. Like, yeah, right, my bud's just saying that. But then
I remembered, this crew had always kept it real. No lies. No flattery.

For a second there, I was about to blow it off. Like, yeah, right, my bud's just saying that. But then
I remembered, this crew had always kept it real. No lies. No flattery.
Yeah... We kicked butt because we believed in one another. These guys were my best friends...

And maybe we weren't perfect. I mean, we lost to Id, but  put his
captain boots on, and got right back up, and tried again...

And maybe we weren't perfect. I mean, we lost to Id, but  put her
captain boots on, and got right back up, and tried again...
It was never about swords or magic... It was about always moving forward, never giving up.
And more than anything, it was about being there for each other.

What was I worrying about? Who cares if I couldn't fight? There are a million and two ways to help
on an adventure. I mean, you try questin' without a cook or a healer.

"Hello? Merchant to Vyrn, do you read me? If you're done daydreaming now, I've got a ship ready
to go."
It was time to get a move on! Or I wasn't worth my scales!
"Sorry, everybody. Your pal Vyrn is on his way!"
Those supplies should be this way. Let's move.

Uh-oh, our potion stock's running low. We'll be okay against
a few goblins, right?
Hopefully. Just don't overdo it.
Hopefully. Just don't overdo it.
Sure hope Vyrn's okay.
I hope Vyrn's okay.
He was really down, wasn't he? Poor Vyrn...
Get out of our way! We're in a hurry here!

Damn, they're back for more! And right when we were about
to cross the finish line...

I see people—over there by the supplies! We have to go help
them!
You folks doin' okay?!
Skyfarers! We're doing better now!

We need these supplies to repair Tempeal. Please, would you
protect them?
We're on it! Take cover, okay?
We're on it! Take cover, okay?
Phew. I think that was the last of them.
Thank you! You've saved Tempeal's future!
Head's up! Goblin reinforcements! They just don't quit!
Hyaaaaah!
Did ya miss me? Took me forever to catch up!
Vyrn!
Vyrn!
Vyrn... Was that an explosive? When did you get bombs?!

Here come more of those stinking gobbos! Can you take
'em?
Sure can!
Sure can!
Yikes! Wyverns are coming from above! Watch your noggins!

If those goblins manage to steal any more of the supplies,
then the relief effort's good as done!

No kidding! They've already hauled half our grain to higher
ground!
Higher ground? Sounds like a job for a cool dragon!
That's a great idea, Vyrn! Put your wings to use!
Are you sure you can manage? What if the goblins spot you?

Piece o' cake! I'll be back in thirty seconds or your money
back!
Here! I brought potions! Everyone feeling better?
Thanks, Vyrn! You're a lifesaver!
Thanks, Vyrn! You're a lifesaver!
I've got plenty of potions left! Do your best, everybody!
Anyone need healing? I've got potions to spare!
Here! This should help! Give it your all!
I found some of the stolen supplies! They're safe and sound!
Here's the second bunch!
Those goblins are gettin' nastier... Don't fall for their tricks!

Yeah! We got 'em all back! Those stinking gobbos didn't get a
single sack!

The enemy have started their retreat. I think the worst has
passed.

Thanks to you skyfarers, Tempeal's finally gonna be rebuilt.
We owe you everything.
Vyrn was the real MVP!
Vyrn was the real MVP!
Aww, shucks. I bet you say that to all your lifelong pals.

After we'd secured the supplies, Vyrn talked about how he didn't think he was good enough for the
crew. Obviously, he was the only one that felt that way.

After we'd secured the supplies, Vyrn talked about how he didn't think he was good enough for the
crew. Obviously, he was the only one that felt that way.

I'd always appreciated his support. During fights, he was a supply runner, lookout, and
cheerleader. And both on and off the battlefield, he was my courage.

I'd always appreciated his support. During fights, he was a supply runner, lookout, and
cheerleader. And both on and off the battlefield, he was my courage.

But even the best people—and dragons—get discouraged sometimes. I really should've been
more vocal about my appreciation.

But even the best people—and dragons—get discouraged sometimes. I really should've been
more vocal about my appreciation.

I made sure he knows now. We won the day because he came flying to the rescue. Just like I knew
he would.

But he knows now. We won the day because he came flying to the rescue. Just like I knew he
would.
"Heh-heh! I'll always be there for ya, pal!"

He was back to his old self, basking in the praise of the crew... Which caused his ego to swell like
a balloon, but hey, who doesn't need a little confidence boost after a dip?

He was back to his old self, basking in the praise of the crew... Which caused his ego to swell like
a balloon, but hey, who doesn't need a little confidence boost after a dip?

And Vyrn... Let me just say it now. I value you and all the hard work you do. From the bottom of
my heart, thank you.

And Vyrn... Let me just say it now. I value you and all the hard work you do. From the bottom of
my heart, thank you.
Some time after our mission in Tempeal, we bumped into the old merchant in Folca.
Some time after our mission in Tempeal, we bumped into the old merchant in Folca.

"Well, look who the cat dragged in! Thanks for handling things in Tempeal. You all deserve the
best."

Tempeal had been roughed up by Furycane's rampage, and all of the locals were busy repairing
the damage. The work we did that day had been crucial to those recovery efforts.

Tempeal had been roughed up by Furycane's rampage, and all of the locals were busy repairing
the damage. The work we did that day had been crucial to those recovery efforts.
"Out of curiosity, my young lizard friend... Were you much help to your crew?"
Uh-oh. He said the 'L' word. I turned to Vyrn, ready for his usual, furious tagline.
Uh-oh. He said the 'L' word. I turned to Vyrn, ready for his usual, furious tagline.
"Thanks, pops. You really helped me see the light."
Huh. This was new.
Huh. This was new.

The old man threw an apple to Vyrn, and they exchanged a nod. Then, without explaining this
bizarre bond between them that just came out of the blue, he left.

The old man threw an apple to Vyrn, and they exchanged a nod. Then, without explaining this
bizarre bond between them that just came out of the blue, he left.
"Um. Does anyone else feel like the space-time continuum just broke?"

Io was staring dumbfounded at the small dragon, who was already happily munching away on a
tart granny smith. Had he... matured? Enough to ignore his most hated of hated insults?

Io was staring dumbfounded at the small dragon, who was already happily munching away on a
tart granny smith. Had he... matured? Enough to ignore his most hated of hated insults?

"Seriously, this is just too much to believe. He called you a lizard and everything. Maybe the ship
will be a little quieter from now on, huh?"
"Hold it, I ain't no lizard! And don't you say that in front of the apple! What if it hears you?"
Ahaha. Maybe he'd get there in another adventure or two.
Ahaha. Maybe he'd get there in another adventure or two.
"I'm gonna go get this report turned in."
"I'm gonna go get this report turned in."
"Much thanks, . Paperwork is... hmm..."

Since the crew started helping Id with his job as the new Mr. Fix It, we'd been really busy. The shop
was completely flooded with requests.
Those sad days when the islanders didn't trust Id, they seemed like a lie now.
"Lyria. How are you feeling today?"
Id asked me that every time we met.
"We're all worried about you... How's the life link holding up?"
Right. Our life link. Everyone thought it might've weakened when I was absorbed by Angra Mainyu.

Honestly, I had been really scared back then... But now, with the weight of the sky off our
shoulders, I felt better than ever!

I flashed Vyrn and Id a smile to let them know I was okay. Talking about the life link brought back
memories and I realized Id still knew almost nothing about our adventures.

I began by explaining Katalina's daring rescue of me and our escape from the Erste Empire. Then I
described the big trees of Zinkenstill and the imperial hydra... And the sad reason I needed to
make the life link with .

Eventually, we met Rackam and Io, Rosetta and Eugen—and before we knew it, our ship was full!
It's really amazing, how much our family has grown.

The whole time, Id sat there—i-in silence, yes—but I could tell he was giving me 110% of his
attention!

"Since getting to Zegagrande, we've had a heck of a wild ride. But now that things have calmed
down, we can get to making some good memories."
"Sure..."

I think I'm starting to understand Id. Sure, he has two modes—cold and colder—but if you really
pay attention, you can see he has a warm enough heart.

Id, , the crew... You're the best friends I could ever ask for. Here's to hoping we'll be
together forever.

After some exciting paperwork, I returned to find Lyria and Vyrn taking Id on a walk down memory
lane.

After some exciting paperwork, I returned to find Lyria and Vyrn taking Id on a walk down memory
lane.
"You guys have seen some amazing things..."

This was coming from someone who survived Lilith's schemes and won a mind-battle with a god
dragon... We'd all been through a lot.

This was coming from someone who survived Lilith's schemes and won a mind-battle with a god
dragon... I guess game recognizes game.

"It's all because  looks out for us. Yep, my bud is epic! You saw 'em save Lyria
and this whole freaking skydom!"

"It's all because  looks out for us. Yep, my bud is epic! You saw 'em save Lyria
and this whole freaking skydom!"
I turned to look at Vyrn, open-mouthed. Where was all this coming from?
I turned to look at Vyrn, open-mouthed. Where was all this coming from?

"I'm just trying to be vocal about my appreciation, remember? So yeah! Take care of Lyria and
keep up the good work!"
I could certainly manage that!
I could certainly manage that!
"Just remembered. Siero got us a whole bag of sweets, as thanks for all our hard work."
"Just remembered. Siero got us a whole bag of sweets, as thanks for all our hard work."

Lyria and Vyrn exchanged a glance so charged I thought the air between them was going to burst
into flames.

Lyria and Vyrn exchanged a glance so charged I thought the air between them was going to burst
into flames.
"You should've told us that first! Early dragon gets the grub!"
"Hey! No fair! Come on, Vyrn. Waaait!"
And just like that, they were off. Foodies, right?
And just like that, they were off. Foodies, right?
". You got a moment?"

I turned around, about to ask, "you want some too?" But one look at Id's knitted brow, and the
question died on my lips.

I turned around, about to ask, "you want some too?" But one look at Id's knitted brow, and the
question died on my lips.
"Let's duel."
"Let's duel."
Did I just hear that right? Why though? Did he have something against cookies?
Did I just hear that right? Why though? Did he have something against cookies?
"Sorry. It was the stories about your adventures. They put the thought into my head."
Ohh, that's why... Nah, I still got nothing.
Ohh, that's why... Nah, I still got nothing.
"I want to protect Lyria. Just as much as you do."
He stalked away then—and left me staring after him.
He stalked away then—and left me staring after him.

I was still having trouble piecing together his train of thought, but one thing was clear: he was
doing it for Lyria's sake.

I was still having trouble piecing together his train of thought, but one thing was clear: he was
doing it for Lyria's sake.

The duel was to take place at Halewind Altar. Lots of memories there. It's where we first met Id...
Where I lost to him and Lyria was taken from us.

The duel was to take place at Halewind Altar. Lots of memories there. It's where we first met Id...
Where I lost to him and Lyria was taken from us.
"Do you guys really have to do this?"
"We're friends now, right? Friends don't fight each other!"

Lyria and Vyrn tried to talk me out of it the whole way there, but I just kept thinking of the look in
Id's eye. He wasn't going to back down. And I respected that.

Lyria and Vyrn tried to talk me out of it the whole way there, but I just kept thinking of the look in
Id's eye. He wasn't going to back down. And I respected that.

Id had been staring into the distance, like a statue set to guard the altar. He turned when he heard
our footsteps.

Id had been staring into the distance, like a statue set to guard the altar. He turned when he heard
our footsteps.

"Now that we've gotten to know one another, I've come to realize something. There's no one that
can keep Lyria safe better than you."

"Now that we've gotten to know one another, I've come to realize something. There's no one that
can keep Lyria safe better than you."
He took deliberate steps towards me. But this was nothing like the first time we met.
He took deliberate steps towards me. But this was nothing like the first time we met.

Before he'd been terrifying, like a hydra closing in on its prey. But now, there was something
softer about the light in his eyes. You could tell he was there to help.

He'd been terrifying then, like a hydra closing in on its prey. But now, there was something softer
about the light in his eyes. You could tell he was there to help.

"You're the real thing. A hero. You didn't just save Lyria—you saved the skies. And I thought,
maybe if we crossed blades again, I'd learn something. Something that would help me be more
like you."

"You're the real thing. A hero. You didn't just save Lyria—you saved the skies. And I thought,
maybe if we crossed blades again, I'd learn something. Something that would help me be more
like you."

I finally got it. Id and I—there was still a part of us that couldn't tear away from that fateful day at
Halewind Altar. When Id had been a bad guy, and I'd been too weak to protect Lyria.

I finally got it. Id and I—there was still a part of us that couldn't tear away from that fateful day at
Halewind Altar. When Id had been a bad guy, and I'd been too weak to protect Lyria.
But things were different now.
But things were different now.
And this fight was going to prove it.
And this fight was going to prove it.
"I'm not losing this time."
"I'm not losing this time."
"Hah. I'd be disappointed if you did."
I drew my sword and took the first step forward.
I drew my sword and took the first step forward.
Let's do this. Give me everything you've got.
Let's do this. Give me everything you've got.
Okay... Right back at ya!
Okay... Right back at you!
Please... Just promise me you two will be careful!

I mean, we already knew this, but Id's pretty much
unstoppable.
